parameter_indexing_CPI_offset.title: Decimal offset added to chained CPI-U inflation rate to get policy parameter indexing rate
parameter_indexing_CPI_offset.description: Always zero in policy_current_law.json, but non-zero values are allowed in reforms.

FICA_ss_trt_employer.title: Employer side Social Security payroll tax rate
FICA_ss_trt_employer.description: Employer side Social Security FICA rate, including both employer and employee.

FICA_ss_trt_employee.title: Employee side Social Security payroll tax rate
FICA_ss_trt_employee.description: Employee side Social Security FICA rate, including both employer and employee.

SS_Earnings_c.title: Maximum taxable earnings (MTE) for Social Security
SS_Earnings_c.description: Individual earnings below this amount are subjected to Social Security (OASDI) payroll tax.
SS_Earnings_c.notes: This parameter is indexed by the rate of growth in average wages, not by the price inflation rate.

SECA_Earnings_thd.title: Minimum self-employment earnings before trigger SECA liability
SECA_Earnings_thd.description: Individual self-employment earnings below this amount are not subject to SECA taxes.
SECA_Earnings_thd.notes: To compute earnings for this threshold, will multiply net self-employment by 1 - SECA_Earnings_hc

SS_Earnings_thd.title: Additional Taxable Earnings Threshold for Social Security
SS_Earnings_thd.description: Individual earnings above this threshold are subjected to Social Security (OASDI) payroll tax, in addition to earnings below the maximum taxable earnings threshold.

FICA_mc_trt_employer.title: Employer side Medicare payroll tax rate
FICA_mc_trt_employer.description: Employer side Medicare FICA rate, including both employer and employee.

FICA_mc_trt_employee.title: Employee side Medicare payroll tax rate
FICA_mc_trt_employee.description: Employee side Medicare FICA rate, including both employer and employee.

AMEDT_ec.title: Additional Medicare tax earnings exclusion
AMEDT_ec.description: The Additional Medicare Tax rate, AMEDT_rt, applies to all earnings in excess of this excluded amount.

AMEDT_rt.title: Additional Medicare tax rate
AMEDT_rt.description: This is the rate applied to the portion of Medicare wages, RRTA compensation and self-employment income exceeding the Additional Medicare Tax earning exclusion.

SS_all_in_agi.title: Include all social security benefits in AGI
SS_all_in_agi.description: All social security benefits will be included in AGI.

SS_thd1.title: Threshold for Social Security benefit taxability 1
SS_thd1.description: The first threshold for Social Security benefit taxability: if taxpayers have provisional income greater than this threshold, up to rate 1 of their Social Security benefit will be subject to tax under current law.

SS_percentage1.title: Social Security taxable income decimal fraction 1
SS_percentage1.description: Under current law if their provisional income is above the first threshold for Social Security taxability but below the second threshold, taxpayers need to apply this fraction to both the excess of their provisional income over the first threshold and their Social Security benefits, and then include the smaller one in their AGI.

SS_thd2.title: Threshold for Social Security benefit taxability 2
SS_thd2.description: The second threshold for Social Security taxability: if taxpayers have provisional income greater than this threshold, up to rate 2 of their Social Security benefit will be subject to tax under current law.

SS_percentage2.title: Social Security taxable income decimal fraction 2
SS_percentage2.description: Under current law if their provisional income is above the second threshold for Social Security taxability, taxpayers need to apply this fraction to both the excess of their provisional income over the second threshold and their social security benefits, and then include the smaller one in their AGI.

ALD_StudentLoan_hc.title: Adjustment for student loan interest haircut
ALD_StudentLoan_hc.description: This decimal fraction can be applied to limit the student loan interest adjustment allowed.
ALD_StudentLoan_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount will be (1-Haircut)*StudentLoanInterest.

ALD_SelfEmploymentTax_hc.title: Adjustment for self-employment tax haircut
ALD_SelfEmploymentTax_hc.description: This decimal fraction, if greater than zero, reduces the employer equivalent portion of self-employment adjustment.
ALD_SelfEmploymentTax_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1-Haircut)*SelfEmploymentTaxAdjustment.

ALD_SelfEmp_HealthIns_hc.title: Adjustment for self employed health insurance haircut
ALD_SelfEmp_HealthIns_hc.description: This decimal fraction, if greater than zero, reduces the health insurance adjustment for self-employed taxpayers.
ALD_SelfEmp_HealthIns_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1-Haircut)*SelfEmployedHealthInsuranceAdjustment.

ALD_KEOGH_SEP_hc.title: Adjustment for contributions to either KEOGH or SEP plan haircut
ALD_KEOGH_SEP_hc.description: Under current law, contributions to Keogh or SEP plans can be fully deducted from gross income.  This haircut can be used to limit the adjustment allowed.

ALD_EarlyWithdraw_hc.title: Adjustment for early withdrawal penalty haircut
ALD_EarlyWithdraw_hc.description: Under current law, early withdraw penalty can be fully deducted from gross income. This haircut can be used to limit the adjustment allowed.

ALD_AlimonyPaid_hc.title: Adjustment for alimony-paid haircut
ALD_AlimonyPaid_hc.description: Under pre-TCJA law, the full amount of alimony paid is taken as an adjustment from gross income in arriving at AGI. This haircut can be used to change the deduction allowed.
ALD_AlimonyPaid_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1-Haircut)*AlimonyPaid.

ALD_AlimonyReceived_hc.title: Adjustment for alimony-received haircut
ALD_AlimonyReceived_hc.description: Under pre-TCJA law, none of alimony received is taken as an adjustment from gross income in arriving at AGI. This haircut can be used to change the deduction allowed.
ALD_AlimonyReceived_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1-Haircut)*AlimonyReceived.

ALD_EducatorExpenses_hc.title: Deduction for educator expenses haircut
ALD_EducatorExpenses_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of educator expenses that can be deducted from AGI.
ALD_EducatorExpenses_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1-Haircut)*EducatorExpenses.

ALD_HSADeduction_hc.title: Deduction for HSA deduction haircut
ALD_HSADeduction_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of a taxpayer's HSA deduction that can be deducted from AGI.
ALD_HSADeduction_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1-Haircut)*HSA_Deduction.

ALD_IRAContributions_hc.title: Deduction for IRA contributions haircut
ALD_IRAContributions_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of IRA contributions that can be deducted from AGI.
ALD_IRAContributions_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1-Haircut)*IRA_Contribution.

ALD_DomesticProduction_hc.title: Deduction for domestic production activity haircut
ALD_DomesticProduction_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of domestic production activity that can be deducted from AGI.
ALD_DomesticProduction_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1-Haircut)*DomesticProductionActivity.

ALD_Tuition_hc.title: Deduction for tuition and fees haircut
ALD_Tuition_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of tuition and fees that can be deducted from AGI.
ALD_Tuition_hc.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1-Haircut)*TuitionFees.

ALD_InvInc_ec_rt.title: Investment income exclusion rate haircut
ALD_InvInc_ec_rt.description: Decimal fraction of investment income base that can be excluded from AGI.
ALD_InvInc_ec_rt.notes: The final taxable investment income will be (1-_ALD_InvInc_ec_rt)*investment_income_base. Even though the excluded portion of investment income is not included in AGI, it still is included in investment income used to calculate the Net Investment Income Tax and Earned Income Tax Credit.

ALD_Dependents_hc.title: Deduction for childcare costs haircut
ALD_Dependents_hc.description: This decimal fraction, if greater than zero, reduces the portion of childcare costs that can be deducted from AGI.

ALD_Dependents_Child_c.title: National average childcare costs: ceiling for available childcare deduction.
ALD_Dependents_Child_c.description: The weighted average of childcare costs in the US. 7165 is the weighted average from the 'Child Care in America: 2016 State Fact Sheets'.
ALD_Dependents_Child_c.notes: This is a weighted average of childcare costs in each state

ALD_Dependents_Elder_c.title: Ceiling for elderly care deduction proposed in Trump's tax plan
ALD_Dependents_Elder_c.description: A taxpayer can take an above the line deduction up to this amount if they have an elderly dependent. The Trump 2016 campaign proposal was for $5000.

ALD_Dependents_thd.title: Maximum level of income to qualify for the dependent care deduction
ALD_Dependents_thd.description: A taxpayer can only claim the dependent care deduction if their total income is below this level. The Trump 2016 campaign proposal was for 250000 single, 500000 joint, 250000 separate, 500000 head of household].

ALD_BusinessLosses_c.title: Maximum amount of business losses deductible
ALD_BusinessLosses_c.description: Business losses in excess of this amount may not be deducted from AGI.

II_em.title: Personal and dependent exemption amount
II_em.description: Subtracted from AGI in the calculation of taxable income, per taxpayer and dependent.

II_em_ps.title: Personal exemption phaseout starting income
II_em_ps.description: If taxpayers' AGI is above this level, their personal exemption will start to decrease at the personal exemption phaseout rate (PEP provision).

II_em_prt.title: Personal exemption phaseout rate
II_em_prt.description: Personal exemption amount will decrease by this rate for each dollar of AGI exceeding exemption phaseout start.

II_no_em_nu18.title: Repeal personal exemptions for dependents under age 18
II_no_em_nu18.description: Total personal exemptions will be decreased by the number of dependents under the age of 18.

STD.title: Standard deduction amount
STD.description: Amount filing unit can use as a standard deduction.

STD_Dep.title: Standard deduction for dependents
STD_Dep.description: This is the maximum standard deduction for dependents.

STD_Aged.title: Additional standard deduction for blind and aged
STD_Aged.description: To get the standard deduction for aged or blind individuals, taxpayers need to add this value to regular standard deduction.
STD_Aged.section_2: Additional Standard Deduction For Blind And Aged

STD_allow_charity_ded_nonitemizers.title: Allow standard deduction filers to take the charitable contributions deduction
STD_allow_charity_ded_nonitemizers.description: Extends the charitable contributions deduction to taxpayers who take the standard deduction and make cash donations.  The same percent-of-AGI cap applied to itemized deduction for charitable contributions also apply here, as well as a max on the dollar amount for cash charitable deductions for those taking the standard deduction.

STD_charity_ded_nonitemizers_max.title: Ceiling amount (in dollars) for cash charitable deductions for nonitemizers
STD_charity_ded_nonitemizers_max.description: Puts a ceiling on the dollar of amount of cash charitable contributions deductions for taxpayers who take the standard deduction.

II_credit.title: Personal refundable credit maximum amount
II_credit.description: This credit amount is fully refundable and is phased out based on AGI. It is available to tax units who would otherwise not file.

II_credit_ps.title: Personal refundable credit phaseout start
II_credit_ps.description: The personal refundable credit amount will be reduced for taxpayers with AGI higher than this threshold level.

II_credit_prt.title: Personal refundable credit phaseout rate
II_credit_prt.description: The personal refundable credit amount will be reduced at this rate for each dollar of AGI exceeding the II_credit_ps threshold.

II_credit_nr.title: Personal nonrefundable credit maximum amount
II_credit_nr.description: This credit amount is not refundable and is phased out based on AGI.

II_credit_nr_ps.title: Personal nonrefundable credit phaseout start
II_credit_nr_ps.description: The personal nonrefundable credit amount will be reduced for taxpayers with AGI higher than this threshold level.

II_credit_nr_prt.title: Personal nonrefundable credit phaseout rate
II_credit_nr_prt.description: The personal nonrefundable credit amount will be reduced at this rate for each dollar of AGI exceeding the II_credit_nr_ps threshold.

RRC_c.title: Recovery Rebate Credit maximum amount
RRC_c.description: This credit amount is fully refundable and is phased out based on AGI. It is available for each person in the filing unit, except for dependent filers.
RRC_c.notes: Enacted for 2021 as part of the American Rescue Plan Act

RRC_ps.title: Recovery Rebate Credit phaseout start
RRC_ps.description: The Recovery Rebate Credit amount will be reduced for taxpayers with AGI higher than this threshold level.
RRC_ps.notes: Enacted for 2021 as part of the American Rescue Plan Act

RRC_pe.title: Recovery Rebate Credit phaseout end
RRC_pe.description: The Recovery Rebate Credit amount will be fully phased out for taxpayers with AGI higher than this threshold level.
RRC_pe.notes: Enacted for 2021 as part of the American Rescue Plan Act

RRC_prt.title: Recovery Rebate Credit phaseout rate
RRC_prt.description: The Recovery Rebate Credit will be phased out at this rate for those with income above the phase out start and below the phase out end.
RRC_prt.notes: Used in 2020 as part of the CARES Act

RRC_c_unit.title: Maximum credit for filing unit
RRC_c_unit.description: The maximum credit awarded as part of the Recovery Rebate Credit.
RRC_c_unit.notes: Used in 2020 as part of the CARES Act

RRC_c_kids.title: Recovery Rebate Credit amount per child
RRC_c_kids.description: The credit awarded for each child in an eligible family as part of the Recovery Rebate Credit.
RRC_c_kids.notes: Used in 2020 as part of the CARES Act

ID_Medical_frt.title: Floor (as a decimal fraction of AGI) for deductible medical expenses.
ID_Medical_frt.description: Taxpayers are eligible to deduct the portion of their medical expenses exceeding this fraction of AGI.
ID_Medical_frt.notes: When using PUF data, lowering this parameter value may produce unexpected results because PUF e17500 variable is zero below the floor.

ID_Medical_frt_add4aged.title: Addon floor (as a decimal fraction of AGI) for deductible medical expenses for elderly filing units.
ID_Medical_frt_add4aged.description: Elderly taxpayers have this fraction added to the value of the regular floor rate for deductible medical expenses.  This fraction was -0.025 from 2013 to 2016, but that was temporary and it changed to zero beginning in 2017.
ID_Medical_frt_add4aged.notes: When using PUF data, changing this parameter value may produce unexpected results because PUF e17500 variable is zero below the floor.

ID_Medical_hc.title: Medical expense deduction haircut
ID_Medical_hc.description: This decimal fraction can be applied to limit the amount of medical expense deduction allowed.

ID_Medical_c.title: Ceiling on the amount of medical expense deduction allowed (dollars)
ID_Medical_c.description: The amount of medical expense deduction is limited to this dollar amount.

ID_StateLocalTax_hc.title: State and local income and sales taxes deduction haircut.
ID_StateLocalTax_hc.description: This decimal fraction reduces the state and local income and sales tax deduction.
ID_StateLocalTax_hc.section_2: State And Local Income And Sales Taxes

ID_StateLocalTax_crt.title: Ceiling (as a decimal fraction of AGI) for the combination of all state and local income and sales tax deductions.
ID_StateLocalTax_crt.description: The total deduction for state and local taxes is capped at this fraction of AGI.
ID_StateLocalTax_crt.section_2: State And Local Income And Sales Taxes

ID_StateLocalTax_c.title: Ceiling on the amount of state and local income and sales taxes deduction allowed (dollars)
ID_StateLocalTax_c.description: The amount of state and local income and sales taxes deduction is limited to this dollar amount.
ID_StateLocalTax_c.section_2: State And Local Income And Sales Taxes

ID_RealEstate_hc.title: State, local, and foreign real estate taxes deduction haircut.
ID_RealEstate_hc.description: This decimal fraction reduces real estate taxes paid eligible to deduct in itemized deduction.
ID_RealEstate_hc.section_2: State, Local, And Foreign Real Estate Taxes

ID_RealEstate_crt.title: Ceiling (as a decimal fraction of AGI) for the combination of all state, local, and foreign real estate tax deductions.
ID_RealEstate_crt.description: The total deduction for all real estate taxes is capped at this fraction of AGI.
ID_RealEstate_crt.section_2: State, Local, And Foreign Real Estate Taxes

ID_RealEstate_c.title: Ceiling on the amount of state, local, and foreign real estate taxes deduction allowed (dollars)
ID_RealEstate_c.description: The amount of real estate taxes deduction is limited to this dollar amount.
ID_RealEstate_c.section_2: State, Local, And Foreign Real Estate Taxes

ID_AllTaxes_hc.title: State and local income, sales, and real estate tax deduction haircut.
ID_AllTaxes_hc.description: This decimal fraction reduces all state and local taxes paid eligible to deduct in itemized deduction.
ID_AllTaxes_hc.section_2: State And Local Taxes And Real Estate Taxes

ID_AllTaxes_c.title: Cap on the amount of state and local income, sales and real estate tax deductions allowed (dollars)
ID_AllTaxes_c.description: The amount of state and local income, sales and real estate tax deductions is limited to this dollar amount.
ID_AllTaxes_c.section_2: State And Local Taxes And Real Estate Taxes

ID_AllTaxes_c_ps.title: AGI level at which ID_AllTaxes_c cap starts to be phased out
ID_AllTaxes_c_ps.description: The cap on state and local income, sales and real estate tax deductions is phased out when AGI exceeds this amount.
ID_AllTaxes_c_ps.section_2: State And Local Taxes And Real Estate Taxes

ID_AllTaxes_c_po_rate.title: Rate at which ID_AllTaxes_c cap is phased-out above ID_AllTaxes_c_ps AGI
ID_AllTaxes_c_po_rate.description: The cap on state and local income, sales and real estate tax deductions is reduced at this rate when AGI exceeds ID_AllTaxes_c_ps.
ID_AllTaxes_c_po_rate.section_2: State And Local Taxes And Real Estate Taxes

ID_AllTaxes_c_po_floor.title: Minimum cap on itemized state and local income, sales and real estate tax deductions that are phased-out above ID_AllTaxes_ps AGI
ID_AllTaxes_c_po_floor.description: The cap on state and local income, sales and real estate tax deductions cannot be reduced below this amount.
ID_AllTaxes_c_po_floor.section_2: State And Local Taxes And Real Estate Taxes

ID_InterestPaid_hc.title: Interest paid deduction haircut
ID_InterestPaid_hc.description: This decimal fraction can be applied to limit the amount of interest paid deduction allowed.

ID_InterestPaid_c.title: Ceiling on the amount of interest paid deduction allowed (dollars)
ID_InterestPaid_c.description: The amount of interest paid deduction is limited to this dollar amount.

ID_Charity_crt_all.title: Ceiling (as a decimal fraction of AGI) for all charitable contribution deductions
ID_Charity_crt_all.description: The total deduction for charity is capped at this fraction of AGI.
ID_Charity_crt_all.notes: When using PUF data, raising this parameter value may produce unexpected results because in PUF data the variables e19800 and e20100 are already capped.

ID_Charity_crt_noncash.title: Ceiling (as a decimal fraction of AGI) for noncash charitable contribution deductions
ID_Charity_crt_noncash.description: The deduction for noncash charity contributions is capped at this fraction of AGI.
ID_Charity_crt_noncash.notes: When using PUF data, raising this parameter value may produce unexpected results because in PUF data the variables e19800 and e20100 are already capped.

ID_Charity_frt.title: Floor (as a decimal fraction of AGI) for deductible charitable contributions.
ID_Charity_frt.description: Taxpayers are eligible to deduct the portion of their charitable expense exceeding this fraction of AGI.
ID_Charity_frt.notes: This parameter allows for implementation of Option 52 from https://www.cbo.gov/sites/default/files/cbofiles/attachments/49638-BudgetOptions.pdf.

ID_Charity_hc.title: Charity expense deduction haircut
ID_Charity_hc.description: This decimal fraction can be applied to limit the amount of charity expense deduction allowed.

ID_Charity_c.title: Ceiling on the amount of charity expense deduction allowed (dollars)
ID_Charity_c.description: The amount of charity expense deduction is limited to this dollar amount.

ID_Charity_f.title: Floor on the amount of charity expense deduction allowed (dollars)
ID_Charity_f.description: Only charitable giving in excess of this dollar amount is eligible for a deduction.

ID_Casualty_frt.title: Floor (as a decimal fraction of AGI) for deductible casualty loss.
ID_Casualty_frt.description: Taxpayers are eligible to deduct the portion of their gross casualty losses exceeding this fraction of AGI.

ID_Casualty_hc.title: Casualty expense deduction haircut
ID_Casualty_hc.description: This decimal fraction can be applied to limit the amount of casualty expense deduction allowed.

ID_Casualty_c.title: Ceiling on the amount of casualty expense deduction allowed (dollars)
ID_Casualty_c.description: The amount of casualty expense deduction is limited to this dollar amount.

ID_Miscellaneous_frt.title: Floor (as a decimal fraction of AGI) for deductible miscellaneous expenses.
ID_Miscellaneous_frt.description: Taxpayers are eligible to deduct the portion of their miscellaneous expense exceeding this fraction of AGI.
ID_Miscellaneous_frt.notes: When using PUF data, lowering this parameter value may produce unexpected results because in PUF data the variable e20400 is zero below the floor.

ID_Miscellaneous_hc.title: Miscellaneous expense deduction haircut
ID_Miscellaneous_hc.description: This decimal fraction can be applied to limit the amount of miscellaneous expense deduction allowed.

ID_Miscellaneous_c.title: Ceiling on the amount of miscellaneous expense deduction allowed (dollars)
ID_Miscellaneous_c.description: The amount of miscellaneous expense deduction is limited to this dollar amount.

ID_ps.title: Itemized deduction phaseout AGI start (Pease provision)
ID_ps.description: The itemized deductions will be reduced for taxpayers with AGI higher than this level.

ID_prt.title: Itemized deduction phaseout rate (Pease provision)
ID_prt.description: Taxpayers will not be eligible to deduct the full amount of itemized deduction if their AGI is above the phaseout start. The deductible portion would be decreased at this rate for each dollar exceeding the start.
ID_prt.notes: This phaseout rate cannot be lower than 0.03 for each dollar, due to limited data on non-itemizers.

ID_crt.title: Itemized deduction maximum phaseout as a decimal fraction of total itemized deductions (Pease provision)
ID_crt.description: The phaseout amount is capped at this fraction of the original total deduction.

ID_reduction_rate.title: Itemized deduction reduction rate under OBBBA
ID_reduction_rate.description: Itemized deductions are reduced if pre-deduction taxable income exceeds top tax bracket.
ID_reduction_rate.notes: The 2026+ value of 0.05405405 is about equal to 2/37.

ID_c.title: Ceiling on the amount of itemized deductions allowed (dollars)
ID_c.description: The amount of itemized deductions is limited to this dollar amount.
ID_c.section_2: Ceiling On The Amount Of Itemized Deductions Allowed

Capital_loss_limitation.title: Limitation on the amount of capital losses deductible
Capital_loss_limitation.description: The amount of capital loss deductions is limited to this dollar amount.
Capital_loss_limitation.notes: Note that some datasets may limit the usefulness of this parameter.  For example the IRS Public Use File (PUF) does not report capital losses in excess of the current law limitation (e.g., $,3000) and therefore setting a higher limit will not affect results.
Capital_loss_limitation.section_2: Regular - Long Term Capital Gains And Qualified Dividends

CG_rt1.title: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (regular/non-AMT) rate 1
CG_rt1.description: The capital gain and dividends (stacked on top of regular income) that are below threshold 1 are taxed at this rate.
CG_rt1.section_2: Regular - Long Term Capital Gains And Qualified Dividends

CG_brk1.title: Top of long-term capital gains and qualified dividends (regular/non-AMT) tax bracket 1
CG_brk1.description: The gains and dividends (stacked on top of regular income) below this are taxed at capital gain rate 1.
CG_brk1.section_2: Regular - Long Term Capital Gains And Qualified Dividends

CG_rt2.title: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (regular/non-AMT) rate 2
CG_rt2.description: The capital gain and dividends (stacked on top of regular income) that are below threshold 2 and above threshold 1 are taxed at this rate.
CG_rt2.section_2: Regular - Long Term Capital Gains And Qualified Dividends

CG_brk2.title: Top of long-term capital gains and qualified dividends (regular/non-AMT) tax bracket 2
CG_brk2.description: The gains and dividends (stacked on top of regular income) below this and above top of bracket 1 are taxed at capital gain rate 2.
CG_brk2.section_2: Regular - Long Term Capital Gains And Qualified Dividends

CG_rt3.title: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (regular/non-AMT) rate 3
CG_rt3.description: The capital gain and dividends (stacked on top of regular income) that are above threshold 2 and below threshold 3 are taxed at this rate.
CG_rt3.section_2: Regular - Long Term Capital Gains And Qualified Dividends

CG_brk3.title: Top of long-term capital gains and qualified dividend tax (regular/non-AMT) bracket 3
CG_brk3.description: The gains and dividends (stacked on top of regular income) below this and above top of bracket 2 are taxed at the capital gain rate 3; above this they are taxed at capital gain rate 4.  Default value is essentially infinity.
CG_brk3.section_2: Regular - Long Term Capital Gains And Qualified Dividends

CG_rt4.title: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (regular/non-AMT) rate 4
CG_rt4.description: The capital gain and dividends (stacked on top of regular income) that are above threshold 3 are taxed at this rate.
CG_rt4.section_2: Regular - Long Term Capital Gains And Qualified Dividends

AMT_CG_rt1.title: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (AMT) rate 1
AMT_CG_rt1.description: Capital gain and qualified dividends (stacked on top of regular income) below threshold 1 are taxed at this rate.
AMT_CG_rt1.section_2: AMT - Long Term Capital Gains And Qualified Dividends

AMT_CG_brk1.title: Top of long-term capital gains and qualified dividends (AMT) tax bracket 1
AMT_CG_brk1.description: The gains and dividends, stacked last, of AMT taxable income below this are taxed at AMT capital gain rate 1.
AMT_CG_brk1.section_2: AMT - Long Term Capital Gains And Qualified Dividends

AMT_CG_rt2.title: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (AMT) rate 2
AMT_CG_rt2.description: Capital gain and qualified dividend (stacked on top of regular income) below threshold 2 and above threshold 1 are taxed at this rate.
AMT_CG_rt2.section_2: AMT - Long Term Capital Gains And Qualified Dividends

AMT_CG_brk2.title: Top of long-term capital gains and qualified dividends (AMT) tax bracket 2
AMT_CG_brk2.description: The gains and dividends, stacked last, of AMT taxable income below this threshold and above bracket 1 are taxed at AMT capital gain rate 2.
AMT_CG_brk2.section_2: AMT - Long Term Capital Gains And Qualified Dividends

AMT_CG_rt3.title: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (AMT) rate 3
AMT_CG_rt3.description: The capital gain and qualified dividend (stacked on top of regular income) above threshold 2 and below threshold 3 are taxed at this rate.
AMT_CG_rt3.section_2: AMT - Long Term Capital Gains And Qualified Dividends

AMT_CG_brk3.title: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (AMT) threshold 3
AMT_CG_brk3.description: The gains and dividends, stacked last, of AMT taxable income below this and above bracket 2 are taxed at capital gain rate 3; above thisthey are taxed at AMT capital gain rate 4.  Default value is essentially infinity.
AMT_CG_brk3.section_2: AMT - Long Term Capital Gains And Qualified Dividends

AMT_CG_rt4.title: Long term capital gain and qualified dividends (AMT) rate 4
AMT_CG_rt4.description: The capital gain and dividends (stacked on top of regular income) that are above threshold 3 are taxed at this rate.
AMT_CG_rt4.section_2: AMT - Long Term Capital Gains And Qualified Dividends

CG_nodiff.title: Long term capital gains and qualified dividends taxed no differently than regular taxable income
CG_nodiff.description: Specifies whether or not long term capital gains and qualified dividends are taxed like regular taxable income.
CG_nodiff.section_2: Tax All Capital Gains And Dividends The Same As Regular Taxable Income

CG_ec.title: Dollar amount of all capital gains and qualified dividends that are excluded from AGI.
CG_ec.description: Positive value used only if long term capital gains and qualified dividends taxed no differently than regular taxable income.
CG_ec.section_2: Tax All Capital Gains And Dividends The Same As Regular Taxable Income

CG_reinvest_ec_rt.title: Fraction of all capital gains and qualified dividends in excess of the dollar exclusion that are excluded from AGI.
CG_reinvest_ec_rt.description: Positive value used only if long term capital gains and qualified dividends taxed no differently than regular taxable income.  To limit the exclusion to capital gains and dividends invested within one year, set to statutory exclusion rate times the fraction of capital gains and qualified dividends in excess of the exclusion that are assumed to be reinvested within the year.
CG_reinvest_ec_rt.section_2: Tax All Capital Gains And Dividends The Same As Regular Taxable Income

II_rt1.title: Personal income (regular/non-AMT) tax rate 1
II_rt1.description: The lowest tax rate, applied to the portion of taxable income below tax bracket 1.

II_brk1.title: Personal income (regular/non-AMT) tax bracket (upper threshold) 1
II_brk1.description: Taxable income below this threshold is taxed at tax rate 1.

II_rt2.title: Personal income (regular/non-AMT) tax rate 2
II_rt2.description: The second lowest tax rate, applied to the portion of taxable income below tax bracket 2 and above tax bracket 1.

II_brk2.title: Personal income (regular/non-AMT) tax bracket (upper threshold) 2
II_brk2.description: Income below this threshold and above tax bracket 1 is taxed at tax rate 2.

II_rt3.title: Personal income (regular/non-AMT) tax rate 3
II_rt3.description: The third lowest tax rate, applied to the portion of taxable income below tax bracket 3 and above tax bracket 2.

II_brk3.title: Personal income (regular/non-AMT) tax bracket (upper threshold) 3
II_brk3.description: Income below this threshold and above tax bracket 2 is taxed at tax rate 3.

II_rt4.title: Personal income (regular/non-AMT) tax rate 4
II_rt4.description: The tax rate applied to the portion of taxable income below tax bracket 4 and above tax bracket 3.

II_brk4.title: Personal income (regular/non-AMT) tax bracket (upper threshold) 4
II_brk4.description: Income below this threshold and above tax bracket 3 is taxed at tax rate 4.

II_rt5.title: Personal income (regular/non-AMT) tax rate 5
II_rt5.description: The third highest tax rate, applied to the portion of taxable income below tax bracket 5 and above tax bracket 4.

II_brk5.title: Personal income (regular/non-AMT) tax bracket (upper threshold) 5
II_brk5.description: Income below this threshold and above tax bracket 4 is taxed at tax rate 5.

II_rt6.title: Personal income (regular/non-AMT) tax rate 6
II_rt6.description: The second higher tax rate, applied to the portion of taxable income below tax bracket 6 and above tax bracket 5.

II_brk6.title: Personal income (regular/non-AMT) tax bracket 6
II_brk6.description: Income below this threshold and above tax bracket 5 is taxed at tax rate 6.

II_rt7.title: Personal income (regular/non-AMT) tax rate 7
II_rt7.description: The tax rate applied to the portion of taxable income below tax bracket 7 and above tax bracket 6.

II_brk7.title: Personal income (regular/non-AMT) tax bracket 7
II_brk7.description: Income below this threshold and above tax bracket 6 is taxed at tax rate 7; income above this threshold is taxed at tax rate 8.  Default value is essentially infinity.

II_rt8.title: Personal income (regular/non-AMT) tax rate 8
II_rt8.description: The tax rate applied to the portion of taxable income above tax bracket 7.

PT_qbid_rt.title: Pass-through qualified business income deduction rate
PT_qbid_rt.description: Fraction of pass-through business income that may be excluded from taxable income.

PT_qbid_limited.title: Whether qualified business income deduction is limited
PT_qbid_limited.description: If true, various TCJA-like limitations are active, otherwise all those limitations (all PT_qbid_* parameters other than PT_qbid_rt) are inactive.

PT_qbid_taxinc_thd.title: Lower threshold of pre-QBID taxable income
PT_qbid_taxinc_thd.description: Pre-QBID taxable income above this lower threshold implies the QBID amount begins to be limited.

PT_qbid_taxinc_gap.title: Dollar gap between upper and lower threshold of pre-QBID taxable income
PT_qbid_taxinc_gap.description: Pre-QBID taxable income above this upper threshold implies the QBID amount is even more limited.

PT_qbid_w2_wages_rt.title: QBID cap rate on pass-through business W-2 wages paid
PT_qbid_w2_wages_rt.description: QBID is capped at this fraction of W-2 wages paid by the pass-through business if pre-QBID taxable income is above the QBID thresholds.

PT_qbid_alt_w2_wages_rt.title: Alternative QBID cap rate on pass-through business W-2 wages paid
PT_qbid_alt_w2_wages_rt.description: QBID is capped at this fraction of W-2 wages paid by the pass-through business plus some fraction of business property if pre-QBID taxable income is above the QBID thresholds and the alternative cap is higher than the main wage-only cap.

PT_qbid_alt_property_rt.title: Alternative QBID cap rate on pass-through business property owned
PT_qbid_alt_property_rt.description: QBID is capped at this fraction of business property owned plus some fraction of W-2 wages paid by the pass-through business if pre-QBID taxable income is above the QBID thresholds and the alternative cap is higher than the main wage-only cap.

PT_qbid_ps.title: QBID phaseout taxable income start
PT_qbid_ps.description: QBID begins to decrease when pre-QBID taxable income is above this level.

PT_qbid_prt.title: QBID phaseout rate
PT_qbid_prt.description: QBID will decrease at this rate for each dollar of taxable income exceeding QBID phaseout start.

PT_qbid_min_ded.title: Minimum QBID amount
PT_qbid_min_ded.description: QBID will be no less than this amount if qualified business income is not less than PT_qbid_min_qbi.

PT_qbid_min_qbi.title: Minimum QBI amount required for receipt of PT_qbid_min_ded
PT_qbid_min_qbi.description: QBID will be no less than this PT_qbid_min_ded if qualified business income is not less than this amount.

UI_em.title: Unemployment Insurance exemption amount
UI_em.description: The amount of Unemployment Insurance benefits excluded from taxable income.
UI_em.notes: Enacted retroactively for 2020 by the American Rescue Plan Act of 2021

UI_thd.title: Unemployment Insurance exemption cutoff
UI_thd.description: Unemployment Insurance exemption is eliminated when AGI minus Unemployment Insurance goes beyond this threshold.

AMT_em.title: AMT exemption amount
AMT_em.description: The amount of AMT taxable income exempted from AMT.

AMT_prt.title: AMT exemption phaseout rate
AMT_prt.description: AMT exemption will decrease at this rate for each dollar of AMT taxable income exceeding AMT phaseout start.

AMT_em_ps.title: AMT exemption phaseout start
AMT_em_ps.description: AMT exemption starts to decrease when AMT taxable income goes beyond this threshold.

AMT_child_em.title: Child AMT exemption additional income base
AMT_child_em.description: The child's AMT exemption is capped by this amount plus the child's earned income.

AMT_child_em_c_age.title: Age ceiling for special AMT exemption
AMT_child_em_c_age.description: Individuals under this age must use the child AMT exemption rules.

AMT_rt1.title: AMT rate 1
AMT_rt1.description: The tax rate applied to the portion of AMT taxable income below the surtax threshold, AMT bracket 1.

AMT_brk1.title: AMT bracket 1 (upper threshold)
AMT_brk1.description: AMT taxable income below this is subject to AMT rate 1 and above it is subject to AMT rate 1 + the additional AMT rate.

AMT_rt2.title: Additional AMT rate for AMT taxable income above AMT bracket 1
AMT_rt2.description: The additional tax rate applied to the portion of AMT income above the AMT bracket 1.
AMT_rt2.notes: This is the additional tax rate (on top of AMT rate 1) for AMT income above AMT bracket 1.

AMT_em_pe.title: AMT exemption phaseout ending AMT taxable income for Married filing Separately
AMT_em_pe.description: The AMT exemption is entirely disallowed beyond this AMT taxable income level for individuals who are married but filing separately.

CDCC_c.title: Maximum child & dependent care expenses per dependent
CDCC_c.description: The maximum amount of expenses allowed for each qualifying dependent.

CDCC_ps1.title: Child & dependent care credit first phaseout start
CDCC_ps1.description: For taxpayers with AGI over this amount, the rate of the credit is reduced by CDCC_po_rate_per_step for each CDCC_po1_step_size of excess AGI.

CDCC_ps2.title: Child & dependent care credit second phaseout start
CDCC_ps2.description: For taxpayers with AGI over this amount, the rate of the credit is reduced by CDCC_po_rate_per_step for each CDCC_po2_step_size of excess AGI.

CDCC_po1_rate_max.title: Child & dependent care credit maximum rate
CDCC_po1_rate_max.description: The maximum rate for the CDCC; this rate decreases as AGI rises above the CDCC_ps1 and CDCC_ps2 levels.

CDCC_po1_rate_min.title: Child & dependent care credit first phaseout rate minimum
CDCC_po1_rate_min.description: The minimum rate for the first AGI phaseout of the CDCC.

CDCC_po2_rate_min.title: Child & dependent care credit second phaseout rate minimum
CDCC_po2_rate_min.description: The minimum rate for the second AGI phaseout of the CDCC.

CDCC_po1_step_size.title: Child & dependent care credit first phaseout step size
CDCC_po1_step_size.description: The CDCC credit rate is reduced by CDCC_po_rate_per_step for each step (including fractional steps) above the first phase-out start threshold.

CDCC_po2_step_size.title: Child & dependent care credit second phaseout step size
CDCC_po2_step_size.description: The CDCC credit rate is reduced by CDCC_po_rate_per_step for each step (including fractional steps) above the second phase-out start threshold.

CDCC_po_rate_per_step.title: Child & dependent care credit phaseout rate per step
CDCC_po_rate_per_step.description: The CDCC credit rate is reduced by this rate for for each step (including fractional steps) above the phase-out start thresholds.

CDCC_refundable.title: Child & dependent care credit refundable indicator
CDCC_refundable.description: If true, the CDCC is fully refundable.

CTC_c.title: Maximum nonrefundable child tax credit per child
CTC_c.description: The maximum nonrefundable credit allowed for each child.

CTC_c_under6_bonus.title: Bonus child tax credit maximum for qualifying children under six
CTC_c_under6_bonus.description: The maximum amount of child tax credit allowed for each child is increased by this amount for qualifying children under 6 years old.

CTC_include17.title: Whether children of age 17 are eligible for the child tax credit
CTC_include17.description: If true, children eligible for the child tax credit include those of age 17.

CTC_is_refundable.title: Whether the child tax credit is fully refundable
CTC_is_refundable.description: If true, the child tax credit is made fully refundable.
CTC_is_refundable.notes: If true, the Additional Child Tax Credit is not used.

ODC_is_refundable.title: Whether the other dependents tax credit is fully refundable
ODC_is_refundable.description: If true, the other dependents tax credit is made fully refundable.

CTC_ps.title: Child tax credit phaseout MAGI start
CTC_ps.description: Child tax credit begins to decrease when MAGI is above this level; read descriptions of the dependent credit amounts for how they phase out when MAGI is above this level.

CTC_prt.title: Child and dependent tax credit phaseout rate
CTC_prt.description: The amount of the credit starts to decrease at this rate if MAGI is higher than child tax credit phaseout start.

ACTC_c.title: Maximum refundable additional child tax credit
ACTC_c.description: This refundable credit is applied to child dependents and phases out exactly like the CTC amount.

ODC_c.title: Maximum nonrefundable other-dependent credit
ODC_c.description: This nonrefundable credit is applied to non-child dependents and phases out along with the CTC amount.
ODC_c.notes: Became current-law policy with passage of TCJA

NIIT_thd.title: Net Investment Income Tax modified AGI threshold
NIIT_thd.description: If modified AGI is more than this threshold, filing unit is subject to the Net Investment Income Tax.

NIIT_PT_taxed.title: Whether or not partnership and S-corp income is in NIIT base
NIIT_PT_taxed.description: false ==> partnership and S-corp income excluded from NIIT base; true ==> partnership and S-corp income is in NIIT base.

NIIT_rt.title: Net Investment Income Tax rate
NIIT_rt.description: If modified AGI exceeds NIIT_thd, all net investment income is taxed at this rate.

EITC_c.title: Maximum earned income credit
EITC_c.description: This is the maximum amount of earned income credit taxpayers are eligible for; it depends on how many kids they have.

EITC_rt.title: Earned income credit phasein rate
EITC_rt.description: Pre-phaseout credit is minimum of this rate times earnings and the maximum earned income credit.

EITC_basic_frac.title: Fraction of maximum earned income credit paid at zero earnings
EITC_basic_frac.description: This fraction of EITC_c is always paid as a credit and one minus this fraction is applied to the phasein rate, EITC_rt.  This fraction is zero under current law.

EITC_prt.title: Earned income credit phaseout rate
EITC_prt.description: Earned income credit begins to decrease at the this rate when AGI is higher than earned income credit phaseout start AGI.

EITC_ps.title: Earned income credit phaseout start AGI
EITC_ps.description: If AGI is higher than this threshold, the amount of EITC will start to decrease at the phaseout rate.

EITC_ps_MarriedJ.title: Extra earned income credit phaseout start AGI for married filling jointly
EITC_ps_MarriedJ.description: This is the additional amount added on the regular phaseout start amount for taxpayers with filling status of married filing jointly.

EITC_MinEligAge.title: Minimum Age for Childless EITC Eligibility
EITC_MinEligAge.description: For a childless filing unit, at least one individual's age needs to be no less than this age (but no greater than the EITC_MaxEligAge) in order to be eligible for an earned income tax credit.

EITC_MaxEligAge.title: Maximum Age for Childless EITC Eligibility
EITC_MaxEligAge.description: For a childless filing unit, at least one individual's age needs to be no greater than this age (but no less than the EITC_MinEligAge) in order to be eligible for an earned income tax credit.

EITC_InvestIncome_c.title: Maximum investment income before EITC reduction
EITC_InvestIncome_c.description: The EITC amount is reduced when investment income exceeds this ceiling.

EITC_excess_InvestIncome_rt.title: Rate of EITC reduction when investment income exceeds ceiling
EITC_excess_InvestIncome_rt.description: The EITC amount is reduced at this rate per dollar of investment income exceeding the ceiling.

EITC_indiv.title: EITC is computed for each spouse based on individual earnings
EITC_indiv.description: Current-law value is false implying EITC is filing-unit based; a value of true implies EITC is computed for each individual wage earner.  The additional phaseout start for joint filers is not affected by this parameter, nor are investment income and age eligibilty rules.

EITC_sep_filers_elig.title: Separate filers are eligibile for the EITC
EITC_sep_filers_elig.description: Current-law value is false, implying ineligibility.

RPTC_c.title: Maximum refundable payroll tax credit
RPTC_c.description: This is the maximum amount of the refundable payroll tax credit for each taxpayer/spouse.
RPTC_c.notes: Positive values of RPTC_c and RPTC_rt can be used to emulate a payroll tax exemption, the implied value of which is RPTC_c divided by RPTC_rt.

RPTC_rt.title: Refundable payroll tax credit phasein rate
RPTC_rt.description: Pre-phaseout credit is minimum of this rate times earnings and the maximum refundable payroll tax credit, where earnings is defined as in FICA and SECA.
RPTC_rt.notes: Positive values of RPTC_c and RPTC_rt can be used to emulate a payroll tax exemption, the implied value of which is RPTC_c divided by RPTC_rt.

LLC_Expense_c.title: Lifetime learning credit expense limit
LLC_Expense_c.description: The maximum expense eligible for lifetime learning credit, per child.

ETC_pe_Single.title: Education tax credit phaseout ends (single and other non-joint)
ETC_pe_Single.description: The education tax credit will be zero for those taxpayers of non-joint filing status with modified AGI (in thousands) higher than this level.

ETC_pe_Married.title: Education tax credit phaseout ends (joint)
ETC_pe_Married.description: The education tax credit will be zero for those taxpayers of married filing joint status with modified AGI level (in thousands) higher than this level.

ACTC_rt.title: Additional Child Tax Credit rate
ACTC_rt.description: This is the fraction of earnings used in calculating the ACTC, which is a partially refundable credit that supplements the CTC for some taxpayers.

ACTC_rt_bonus_under6family.title: Bonus additional child tax credit rate for families with qualifying children under 6
ACTC_rt_bonus_under6family.description: For families with qualifying children under 6 years old, this bonus rate is added to the fraction of earnings (additional child tax credit rate) used in calculating the ACTC.

ACTC_Income_thd.title: Additional Child Tax Credit income threshold
ACTC_Income_thd.description: The portion of earned income below this threshold does not count as base for the Additional Child Tax Credit.

ACTC_ChildNum.title: Additional Child Tax Credit minimum number of qualified children for different formula
ACTC_ChildNum.description: Families with this number of qualified children or more may qualify for a different formula to calculate the Additional Child Tax Credit, which is a partially refundable credit that supplements the Child Tax Credit for some taxpayers.

CTC_new_c.title: New refundable child tax credit maximum amount per child
CTC_new_c.description: In addition to all credits currently available for dependents, this parameter gives each qualifying child a new refundable credit with this maximum amount.
CTC_new_c.notes: Child age qualification for the new child tax credit is the same as under current-law Child Tax Credit.

CTC_new_c_under6_bonus.title: Bonus new refundable child tax credit maximum for qualifying children under six
CTC_new_c_under6_bonus.description: The maximum amount of the new refundable child tax credit allowed for each child is increased by this amount for qualifying children under 6 years old.

CTC_new_for_all.title: Whether or not maximum amount of the new refundable child tax credit is available to all
CTC_new_for_all.description: The maximum amount of the new refundable child tax credit does not depend on AGI when true; otherwise, see CTC_new_rt.

CTC_new_rt.title: New refundable child tax credit amount phasein rate
CTC_new_rt.description: The maximum amount of the new child tax credit is increased at this rate per dollar of positive AGI until CTC_new_c times the number of qualified children is reached if CTC_new_for_all is false; if CTC_new_for_all is true, there is no AGI limitation to the maximum amount.
CTC_new_rt.notes: Child age qualification for the new child tax credit is the same as under current-law Child Tax Credit.

CTC_new_ps.title: New refundable child tax credit phaseout starting AGI
CTC_new_ps.description: The total amount of new child tax credit is reduced for taxpayers with AGI higher than this level.

CTC_new_prt.title: New refundable child tax credit amount phaseout rate
CTC_new_prt.description: The total amount of the new child tax credit is reduced at this rate per dollar exceeding the phaseout starting AGI, CTC_new_ps.

CTC_new_refund_limited.title: New child tax credit refund limited to a decimal fraction of payroll taxes
CTC_new_refund_limited.description: Specifies whether the new child tax credit refund is limited by the new child tax credit refund limit rate (_CTC_new_refund_limit_payroll_rt).
CTC_new_refund_limited.notes: Set this parameter to true to limit the refundability or false to allow full refundability for all taxpayers.

CTC_new_refund_limit_payroll_rt.title: New child tax credit refund limit rate (decimal fraction of payroll taxes)
CTC_new_refund_limit_payroll_rt.description: The fraction of payroll taxes (employee plus employer shares, but excluding all Medicare payroll taxes) that serves as a limit to the amount of new child tax credit that can be refunded.
CTC_new_refund_limit_payroll_rt.notes: Set this parameter to zero for no refundability; set it to 9e99 for unlimited refundability for taxpayers with payroll tax liabilities.

CTC_new_refund_limited_all_payroll.title: New child tax credit refund limit applies to all FICA taxes, not just OASDI
CTC_new_refund_limited_all_payroll.description: Specifies whether the new child tax credit refund limit rate (_CTC_new_refund_limit_payroll_rt) applies to all FICA taxes (true) or just OASDI taxes (false).
CTC_new_refund_limited_all_payroll.notes: If the new CTC is limited, set this parameter to true to limit the refundability to all FICA taxes or false to limit refundabiity to OASDI taxes.

FST_AGI_trt.title: New minimum tax; rate as a decimal fraction of AGI
FST_AGI_trt.description: Individual income taxes and the employee share of payroll taxes are credited against this minimum tax, so the surtax is the difference between the tax rate times AGI and the credited taxes. The new minimum tax is similar to the Fair Share Tax, except that no credits are exempted from the base.

FST_AGI_thd_lo.title: Minimum AGI needed to be subject to the new minimum tax
FST_AGI_thd_lo.description: A taxpayer is only subject to the new minimum tax if they exceed this level of AGI.

FST_AGI_thd_hi.title: AGI level at which the New Minimum Tax is fully phased in
FST_AGI_thd_hi.description: The new minimum tax will be fully phased in at this level of AGI. If there is no phase-in, this upper threshold should be set equal to the lower AGI threshold.

AGI_surtax_trt.title: New AGI surtax rate
AGI_surtax_trt.description: The surtax rate is applied to the portion of Adjusted Gross Income above the AGI surtax threshold.

AGI_surtax_thd.title: Threshold for the new AGI surtax
AGI_surtax_thd.description: The aggregate gross income above this AGI surtax threshold is taxed at surtax rate on AGI.

LST.title: Dollar amount of lump-sum tax
LST.description: The lump-sum tax is levied on every member of a tax filing unit. The lump-sum tax is included only in combined taxes; it is not included in income or payroll taxes.

UBI_u18.title: UBI benefit for those under 18
UBI_u18.description: UBI benefit provided to people under 18.

UBI_1820.title: UBI benefit for those 18 through 20
UBI_1820.description: UBI benefit provided to people 18-20 years of age.

UBI_21.title: UBI benefit for those 21 and over
UBI_21.description: UBI benefit provided to people 21 and over.

UBI_ecrt.title: Fraction of UBI benefits excluded from AGI
UBI_ecrt.description: One minus this fraction of UBI benefits are taxable and will be added to AGI.

CR_RetirementSavings_hc.title: Credit for retirement savings haircut
CR_RetirementSavings_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of the retirement savings credit that can be claimed.

CR_ForeignTax_hc.title: Credit for foreign tax haircut
CR_ForeignTax_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of the foreign tax credit that can be claimed.

CR_ResidentialEnergy_hc.title: Credit for residential energy haircut
CR_ResidentialEnergy_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of the residential energy credit that can be claimed.

CR_GeneralBusiness_hc.title: Credit for general business haircut
CR_GeneralBusiness_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of the general business credit that can be claimed.

CR_MinimumTax_hc.title: Credit for previous year minimum tax credit haircut
CR_MinimumTax_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of the previous year minimum tax credit that can be claimed.

CR_AmOppRefundable_hc.title: Refundable portion of the American Opportunity Credit haircut
CR_AmOppRefundable_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of the refundable American Opportunity credit that can be claimed.

CR_AmOppNonRefundable_hc.title: Nonrefundable portion of the American Opportunity Credit haircut
CR_AmOppNonRefundable_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of the nonrefundable American Opportunity credit that can be claimed.

CR_SchR_hc.title: Schedule R Credit haircut
CR_SchR_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of Schedule R credit that can be claimed.

CR_OtherCredits_hc.title: Other Credits haircut
CR_OtherCredits_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of other credit that can be claimed.

CR_Education_hc.title: Education Credits haircut
CR_Education_hc.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction reduces the portion of education credits that can be claimed.

CR_Charity_rt.title: Charity Credit rate
CR_Charity_rt.description: If greater than zero, this decimal fraction represents the portion of total charitable contributions provided as a nonrefundable tax credit.

CR_Charity_f.title: Charity Credit Floor
CR_Charity_f.description: Only charitable giving in excess of this dollar amount is eligible for the charity credit.

CR_Charity_frt.title: Charity Credit Floor Rate
CR_Charity_frt.description: Only charitable giving in excess of this decimal fraction of AGI is eligible for the charity credit.

SeniorDed_c.title: Senior deduction amount per elderly head/spouse
SeniorDed_c.description: Senior deduction is capped at this level per elderly head/spouse.

SeniorDed_ps.title: Senior deduction phase-out start AGI level
SeniorDed_ps.description: Senior deduction is phased-out if AGI exceeds this amount.

SeniorDed_prt.title: Senior deduction phase-out rate
SeniorDed_prt.description: Senior deduction is phased-out at this rate on AGI exceeding SeniorDed_ps.

AutoLoanInterestDed_c.title: Maximum amount of auto loan interest that is deductible
AutoLoanInterestDed_c.description: Auto loan interest in excess of this amount may not be deducted from AGI.

AutoLoanInterestDed_ps.title: Auto loan interest deduction phase-out start AGI
AutoLoanInterestDed_ps.description: Auto loan interest deduction is phased-out if AGI exceeds this amount.

AutoLoanInterestDed_po_step_size.title: Auto loan interest deduction phase-out AGI step size
AutoLoanInterestDed_po_step_size.description: Auto loan interest deduction is phased-out in AGI steps of this size.

AutoLoanInterestDed_po_rate_per_step.title: Auto loan interest deduction phase-out rate per phase-out step
AutoLoanInterestDed_po_rate_per_step.description: Auto loan interest deduction is phased-out at this rate for each AGI step.

ALD_OvertimeIncome_hc.title: Overtime income ALD haircut
ALD_OvertimeIncome_hc.description: Overtime income ALD is subject to this haircut.
ALD_OvertimeIncome_hc.notes: Final ALD amount is multiplied by (1-ALD_OvertimeIncome_hc).

ALD_OvertimeIncome_c.title: Overtime ALD cap
ALD_OvertimeIncome_c.description: Overtime ALD is capped at this level.

ALD_OvertimeIncome_ps.title: Overtime ALD phase-out start earned income level
ALD_OvertimeIncome_ps.description: Overtime ALD is phased-out if earned income exceeds this amount.

ALD_OvertimeIncome_prt.title: Overtime ALD phase-out rate
ALD_OvertimeIncome_prt.description: Overtime ALD is phased-out at this rate on earned income exceeding ALD_OvertimeIncome_ps.

ALD_TipIncome_hc.title: Tip income ALD haircut
ALD_TipIncome_hc.description: Tip income ALD is subject to this haircut.
ALD_TipIncome_hc.notes: Final ALD amount is multiplied by (1-ALD_TipIncome_hc).

ALD_TipIncome_c.title: Tip ALD cap
ALD_TipIncome_c.description: Tip ALD is capped at this level.

ALD_TipIncome_ps.title: Tip ALD phase-out start earned income level
ALD_TipIncome_ps.description: Tip ALD is phased-out if earned income exceeds this amount.

ALD_TipIncome_prt.title: Tip ALD phase-out rate
ALD_TipIncome_prt.description: Tip ALD is phased-out at this rate on earned income exceeding ALD_TipIncome_ps.

BEN_ssi_repeal.title: SSI benefit repeal switch
BEN_ssi_repeal.description: SSI benefits can be repealed by switching this parameter to true.

BEN_housing_repeal.title: Housing benefit repeal switch
BEN_housing_repeal.description: Housing benefits can be repealed by switching this parameter to true.

BEN_snap_repeal.title: SNAP benefit repeal switch
BEN_snap_repeal.description: SNAP benefits can be repealed by switching this parameter to true.

BEN_tanf_repeal.title: TANF benefit repeal switch
BEN_tanf_repeal.description: TANF benefits can be repealed by switching this parameter to true.

BEN_vet_repeal.title: Veterans benefit repeal switch
BEN_vet_repeal.description: Veterans benefits can be repealed by switching this parameter to true.

BEN_wic_repeal.title: WIC benefit repeal switch
BEN_wic_repeal.description: WIC benefits can be repealed by switching this parameter to true.

BEN_mcare_repeal.title: Medicare benefit repeal switch
BEN_mcare_repeal.description: Medicare benefits can be repealed by switching this parameter to true.

BEN_mcaid_repeal.title: Medicaid benefit repeal switch
BEN_mcaid_repeal.description: Medicaid benefits can be repealed by switching this parameter to true.

BEN_oasdi_repeal.title: Social Security benefit repeal switch
BEN_oasdi_repeal.description: Social Security benefits (e02400) can be repealed by switching this parameter to true.

BEN_ui_repeal.title: Unemployment insurance benefit repeal switch
BEN_ui_repeal.description: Unemployment insurance benefits (e02300) can be repealed by switching this parameter to true.

BEN_other_repeal.title: Other benefit repeal switch
BEN_other_repeal.description: Other benefits can be repealed by switching this parameter to true.
